meanings.definition: Resembling a tower in height or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The tall tree in the forest looked towery against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The castle on the hill had a towery silhouette at sunset.
meanings.sent3: The towery mountain of laundry in the corner made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, piled high in a towery bun, made her look regal.
meanings.sent5: The towery skyscraper dominated the city skyline.

meanings.sent1: The ancient city was known for its towery walls and gates.
meanings.sent2: The towery fortress stood strong against any attack.
meanings.sent3: The towery cake at the party was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The towery chess set displayed intricate craftsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The towery spires of the cathedral reached towards the heavens.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of a tower.
meanings.sent1: The towery architecture of the building impressed all who saw it.
meanings.sent2: The towery design of the bridge made it an iconic landmark.
meanings.sent3: The towery umbrella kept her dry even in the heaviest rain.
meanings.sent4: The towery crown on his head symbolized his royal status.
meanings.sent5: The towery lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.
